result.execSummary:
The defendant Bret D. Radman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon - Ordinance Violation. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Bret D. Radman appeared with Attorney Kevin Schmidt.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Status from Atty Schmidt.  Set for trial.  Jury trial scheduled for March 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 6, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on November 28, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant, Bret D. Radman appeared with Attorney Kevin Schmidt.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State. Court calls case and appearances. Court speaks to Atty Schmidt. DA Frost calls Officer Austin Tucker to the testify. Mr Tucker is sworn in by the clerk. Officer Tucker identifies Mr Radman as the DE. Atty Schmidt crosses. DA Frost redirects. Nothing further for Officer Tucker. No Further witnesses. DA Frost - argument. Atty Schmidt - argument. Court speaks to Atty Schmidt. Atty Schmidt - continues argument. Court rejects Atty Schmidt's argument. Atty Schmidt redirects argument. DA Frost - rebuttal. Court refers to statute 968.24. DA Frost - statement. Court finds DE was arrested when placed in hand-cuffs and speaks on Miranda Rights, and to parties. Atty Schmidt - statement. Court rules 1st statement is not surpressed( under the seat), 2nd statement is surpressed, Officer had probable cause to search. Bail will cont.  Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 11:00 am.
